doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
University of Virginia Lawn: The Lawn

Rotunda, 10 Pavilions, 6 Hotels, 109 Dormitory Rooms, Anatomical Hall--Jefferson intended to expand to south by repetition of dorms, pavilions & colonnades--East Gardens steeper and 20' wider than West Gardens

Brick, Tetrastyle Porticos, Lunettes in Tympanums, Chinese Railings, Flemish Bond, 3 Course American Bond, 5 Course American Bond, Penciling, Queens Closers, Triple Hung Sash, Figural Spaces, Dome, Blind Windows, Pergolas, Fanlights, 2 Leaf Doors, 6 Panel Doors, Privys, Gardens, Brick Serpentine Garden Walls, Macadam Alley Paving

survey data: World Heritage List--National Historic Landmark--National Register of Historic Places--Virginia Landmarks Register--Virginia Road Traces--Charlottesville's Historic Landmarks Study Surveys
